channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MA

item.title: Report X-2023071112
item.description:
Report X-2023071112

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-05
  • City: BOYLSTON
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found leaking, placed in to spill bin and brought back to QA cage for further processing. DescribePack: Lid loosened causing material to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed into spill bin to minimize movement and further spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023070120
item.description:
Report X-2023070120

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-28T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-27
  • City: MIDDLEBORO
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was sent up the van line belt to be loaded into a truck. A package handler noticed it was wet and informed QA. QA isolated the wet box at the end of the belt and inspected it for leakage. It was discovered that the cap was loose on the plastic bottle inside of the box, resulting in minimal spillage. The majority was absorbed by the cardboard box, with a small amount leaking onto the walkway of the belt itself. An absorb pad was put down to soak up the spill. DescribePack: The cap was loose on the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Minimal spillage occurred on the van line and absorb pads were put in place to soak up the liquid.

item.title: Report X-2023070127
item.description:
Report X-2023070127

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-27T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-27
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leakage from package was noticed when package was loaded onto outbound trailer. DescribePack: Bottom of 4 L glass bottle shattered. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Quickly transported package in hazmat spill container to fume hood. Placed absorbent pads to soak up spill.

item.title: Report X-2023061710
item.description:
Report X-2023061710

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-27T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-27
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damaged package arrived into station during AM presort leaking, damaging several surrounding packages. DescribePack: 1 of 4 Metal gallon cans leaking from top, lid popped off due to dent in sidewall. All contents leaked out. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Manager loaded damaged hazmat into red hazmat bin and notified QA immediately
